      0

it's stuck in my head

      just common sense really

      that could work

4.10.24  5:46 pm   dont you wish miami was called miaim so its an anagram, so much lost potential

      miami already is an anagram of miaim, although i think you meant to say palindrome

4.10.24  5:27 pm   How do I condition my mind to be able to come up with melodies out of 4/4?

      just pretend the whole thing is in 1/16 and forget about time entirely

4.10.24  4:06 pm   what is the difference between reality and fake

      real means the thing is the thing. fake means thing is other thing. however, there is a loophole in which the language can change so the word for the thing is now the other thing

4.10.24  2:03 pm   Why do you not use pitch correction?

      someone's gotta not do it

      you should be most afraid of not knowing whether or not to be afraid

4.10.24  12:24 pm   Ever experience ego death?

      wouldn't be called that if it actually happened. wouldn't be called anything, in fact

4.10.24  10:57 am   Do you ever want to hit a gong?

      i already hit one once. it's still going

      is there anything that actually stays within the ground plane

4.10.24  7:38 am   what is your favorite invertebrate

      ghosts

4.10.24  5:58 am   Have you ever lost something and have never been able to find it again?

      never? what if i find it tomorrow? never isn't here yet. we'll re-evaluate this issue at the end of time surely

4.10.24  3:53 am   what do you think your meaning of life is

      technically you get to decide

     yes

      is there some kind of secret to it?

     yes, but the secret keeps changing

4.9.24  9:46 pm   what is your favorite number base

      1

4.9.24  7:27 pm   Why is the alphabetical order in the order that it's in?

      what order should it be in

4.9.24  7:05 pm   How often does the initial idea/inspiration/vision really shine through in the end result for your projects? I often find the process of developing the thing changes the result into something I wouldn't have expected but I still usually like in its own right. I also wonder if the realization is improvement; maybe it's always different

      the original idea is probably always there

4.9.24  6:53 pm   if I can find everything inspiring around me then how do I find the time to actually sit down and be creative and actually do things??

Oh wait I might be answering my own question already

      make a list of the things you want to do. then at some point you will find the list exciting. at least that is a starting point

4.9.24  6:04 pm   what do you think about constructed languages

      could work

4.9.24  5:53 pm   could the sun and Jupiter get married?

      they are already in a relationship, which of course is quite polyamorous

4.9.24  5:03 pm   what does irregular time mean when composing a song

      that might mean 'irregular time signature', which might mean the beats aren't grouped in a regular or consistent way. think of it this way, when you tap your foot to the beat of most music, the vast majority of the time this fits neatly into groups of 4 taps. you can almost say "1, 2, 3, 4" repeatedly to the beat, all through the vast majority of most music. but "irregular time" might possibly refer to anything that's...... not like this

4.9.24  3:14 pm   what are the last 5 digits of pi?

      00000

4.9.24  3:10 pm   Do you think songs only stick if you can relate to the feeling in them?

For example, I listened to "if the world doesn't end" and liked it, but I didn't really think about it after that day. Then the other day, I was experiencing something new, and realized *oh*. I went back to the song and related to it infinitely more, and I've had it stuck in my head for the past few days.

It feels like this is common, but is it necessary, a built in trait of music?

      if i could describe exactly how or why music works, then maybe i wouldn't need to use it so much

4.9.24  1:45 pm   ever taken a cold to lukewarm shower while singing Hillary Duff's "Clean" at a volume ranging somewhere between the middle and the top of your lungs, or....

i definitely have, for the record, possibly more than once.

      i have not done that, but my answer doesn't feel important here

4.9.24  11:26 am   Are you able to easily know what songs of yours people are referencing when they just say one line? or does it take you a bit

      some are easier than others

4.9.24  11:16 am   I would love to create accurate (that I'm happy with) chord tabs for some songs such as Money, La De Da, Alphabet Shuffle, etc. It's something I enjoy, and your songs are all so rich with unique harmony and complex chords. However, the RECORDINGS often include many random-seeming notes which make the chords much more complex, making it harder to make what I feel is a "definitive" version, a.k.a. a sort of "prototype" of the song, or how you would write it in your own mind before adding all those decorative instrumentals. My question is, do you usually come up with all those crazy chords right away, or do you start simpler (limiting yourself to maybe m9 or 7sus4 at the maximum complexity, for example)?

      there is a definitive 'written' version in mind, but that's often probably still complex for what people may prefer to read on a page

      no, but that doesn't mean it's not good

please bill I've wondering for a year now

      several times a year, let's say

      could work

4.8.24  11:08 am   what do you think about wizards

      fake

4.8.24  9:31 am   is "ueqstions" pronounced like "ooh-ehck-stions" or is there a better way to pronounce it?

      "questions". the 'q' has a similar function as a capital letter. you don't pronounce it any differently, it's just fancied up because it's the title of the page

4.8.24  7:42 am   Favorite greek letter?

      θ

4.8.24  5:29 am   So I've been working on this project for a while now and I've been struggling to work on it consistently due to anxiety, fear of failure etc. Recently though it's been going pretty well, but the problem now is whenever I'm actually able to work on said project I lose track of almost everything else in my life. Exercise, sleep, eating/drinking regularly and other daily tasks. I kind of get "devoured" by the project and it seems really difficult to keep a balance. Any tips on how to deal with this and sort of find a middle ground?

      i didn't even know there was a middle ground

4.8.24  3:12 am   is the randy in the im feeling randy button supposed to short for random? or is that its own word

      it is a reference to the random selection of which question to read
